Posts.Content: kristensc wrote: I went in for what I thought was removal of a Giant Fibroadenoma and instead was told I have breast cancer. My surgeon has set up abdominal CT, bone scans, genetics testing (because of age and lack of family history) and a PET scan. After that she suggests a radical mastectomy, then chemotherapy and radiation. So far my preliminary pathology report says Grade 3, aggressive and that is all. Can anyone tell me what I can expect from this point as far as how you feel after the mastectomy and going into treatment? Is there also a better place to go for treatment like Cancer Centers of America? kristensc Log in to post a reply
